topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Redis Integration for Developers

ul.li: You already have an ALS cluster.
You have access to the cluster and permission to deploy applications.
Access is allowed into the Redis instance or clustered IP addresses and Redis port 6379. If not, the process for configuring port access is located here.

ol.li:
Create user-provided service in ALS cluster, provide connection credentials
Login to ALS cluster
Get a list of all services in the ALS cluster
Create a new service for binding Redis from applications in the ALS cluster
Validate that the new service is available
Check the credentials are set correctly
Bind to Redis user-provided service from an app during deployment
Deploy your application using helion CLI
Validate the service is bound to your application
